conclusion: At t = 0 the left-moving wavefront is at x = 0.2 m (point P) and the right-moving one is at x = 0.8 m (point Q).
The two advancing fronts are 0.8 m – 0.2 m = 0.6 m apart.
Each wave travels at 0.40 m s⁻¹ but in opposite directions.
Their closing (relative) speed is v_rel = 0.40 m s⁻¹ + 0.40 m s⁻¹ = 0.80 m s⁻¹.
Time required for the two fronts to cover the 0.6 m gap is t = (0.60 m)/(0.80 m s⁻¹) = 0.75 s.
The two waves first meet (their fronts coincide) 0.75 s after the instant shown (t = 0).
